name: Trainz: A New Era - Chicago & North Western GE C40-8
summary: The Chicago and North Western Transportation Company (reporting mark CNW) was a Class I railroad in the Midwest United States.It was also known as the North Western. The railroad operated more than 5,000 miles (8,000 km) of track as of the turn of the 20th century, and over 12,000 miles (19,000 km) of track in seven states.
